comments:
OS: Windows XP SP2
Must fix or not a must fix: Yes
Build date: RAD 6.0.1.1 + ifix 001,002,003a
Component name = TPTP
Blocking: Yes
Language: 
Bitmap Location: 
Tester Name: 
Problem Description:

When user tries to profile a web application he is getting a "An error has occurred. see logs for details " dialog box first and any attempts to 
profile again results in a "stack overflow error".   

Steps:

1. start server (WAS 6.) in profiling mode
2. WAS 6 was up but could not see profile tooling menu

... is there any short-term/workaround relief ?

Created an attachment (id=59274)
how to create problem

Created an attachment (id=59277)
log showing error and stack trace

Eugene please take a look at this defect, the exception happens in java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfilingSetsManager.readFilters(Unknown Source)

customer sent update as below ...

Update: other users have this same error, including the same stack trace 
in the .log, by double-clicking "Attach - Java Process". It just so      
happens that I get this error also when just selecting "Profile" from    
the menu shortcut. Bottom line is we as a development team are unable to 
profile.           

... please expedite ...
Eugene, please follow up on this defect
Eugene is on vacation, I already started the investigation.

Steps to debug the problem:

Method A:
1. Replace RAD6_INSTALL_FOLDER\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui_3.3.0\core_ui.jar with the one attached in the bug.
2. Change directory to RAD6_INSTALL_FOLDER\eclipse and run run.bat attached here from that directory.
3. Check RAD6_INSTALL_FOLDER\eclipse\stdout and RAD6_INSTALL_FOLDER\eclipse\stderr files for any exception and attach them to the bug.
 
Method B:
1.	Import org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui plugin with sources using Import -> External Plug-ins and Fragments wizard.
2.	Replace /org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui/src-core_ui/org/eclipse/hyades/trace/ui/internal/launcher/ProfilingSetsManager.java java file with the one from the bug
3.	Put a breakpoint at the beginning of "void org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfilingSetsManager.readFilters(String  profilingSetsStr)" method
4.	Start a Debug session of RAD in self-hosting mode and check where the NullPointerException happens and report it on the bug.

Created an attachment (id=59732)
RAD6_INSTALL_FOLDER\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui_3.3.0\core_ui.jar 

Modified core_ui.jar, includes the new version of "void org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfilingSetsManager.readFilters(String 
 profilingSetsStr)"

Created an attachment (id=59733)
run.bat

Copy this file into RAD6_INSTALL_FOLDER\eclipse and run it after the core_ui.jar is updated as described in Method A.
Dzung, please let me know when you get more details regarding this problem.

Customer and I used method A and got empty stdout/stderr ... should the command in run.bat included -consolelog parameter ?

We are not clear how to use method B... please give more details...

(In reply to comment #12)
> Customer and I used method A and got empty stdout/stderr ... should the command
> in run.bat included -consolelog parameter ?
> 
> We are not clear how to use method B... please give more details...
> 

You will get empty stdout/stderr if the error doesn't happen, did the error happened during that session, if not please retry until it happens then look at those files?

In Method B you just need to import the specified plug-in with sources and add a try catch like I did in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=59731&action=view (or just override with that version) then put a break point on line "e.printStackTrace();" in readFilters method then debug that plug-in in self host mode (use Debug -> Eclipse Application).

I will close this defect as the problem was fixed, the simple workaround is to delete the following file:

THE_WORKSPACE_ROOT_FOLDER\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.prefs

and then restarting the workbench.

Please open a Hyades 3.3 defect for the migration problem.
Updated target to match the iteration when this defect was processed
